instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02016: What is 820-02016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S2: What is PP3V3_S2? PP3V3_S2 is a typo of PP3V3_S3.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20v
threads.message:
water damaged with some corrosions
I replace 
<RESISTOR>R5222</RESISTOR>,<RESISTOR>R5221</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5262</RESISTOR>,<RESISTOR>R5261</RESISTOR>
UF400 and UF500 
Now the amp meter restarts with 5v, but one of the ports restart more sporadic than the other.  The first ports draws 5v 0.0187A after 10s it goes to 0.00A and restart. 
The  second port restarts after 3 seconds. 
Voltage readings 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> IS -12v
<SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON_VDDMAIN</SIGNAL> IS -3.8v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_AON</SIGNAL> IS -3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_AON</SIGNAL>- 1.8v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S2</SIGNAL>- 5v 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2</SIGNAL>- 3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20v
threads.message: There must be more corroded components, solders or traces.
